eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyInfo: Pepe is swallowed by Mio at the Great Bazaar. Narantuya encounters Woof in the chaos.

attributes.content: Hey! Watch where you're going!
attributes.name: Anxious Passerby

attributes.content: S-Sorry, effendi! I was in a hurry. Are you okay?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Well, I supposed nothing's broken.
attributes.name: Anxious Passerby

attributes.content: Where are you off to in such a hurry? Don't you know there's trouble?
attributes.name: Anxious Passerby

attributes.content: First those metal constructs sent all the gems in the city to the Great Bazaar, now they're tearing down houses and chasing us out of the bazaar.
attributes.name: Anxious Passerby

attributes.content: The constructs are tearing down houses?
attributes.name: Pepe
Anxious Passerby
attributes.content: Yeah! There are flying stones and debris everywhere.

attributes.name: Anxious Passerby
attributes.content: Hey, why are you still going that way? Didn't you hear what I said?
attributes.joined: Yeah! There are flying stones and debris everywhere.Hey, why are you still going that way? Didn't you hear what I said?

attributes.content: I need to see what's going on!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: What do you think you can do, girl?
attributes.name: Anxious Passerby

attributes.content: Hey, girl!
attributes.name: Anxious Passerby

attributes.content: ...No one's here. They've all gone.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: By Horakhet...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The streets, usually bustling with people, are now empty, save for constructs moving in pairs or triplets.
They raise their arms, and houses turn into sand.
From the fallen sand, tall pillars and walls emerge.
Yikes, that almost hit me.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Meow...
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Who was that...?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Mrow...
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Huh, where did this critter come from?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Meow!
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Go, this is no place for you.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Go! Shoo!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The animal is not daunted by her shooing and instead sits down to leisurely lick its own fur.
A suspicious Pepe decides to go around it. As she takes a step, the animal looks up and gazes straight into Pepe's eyes.
In that instant, Pepe feels as though her feet have become nailed to the ground.
But it is such a small animal.
She gathers the courage to take another step forward.
A deafening roar stops her. She feels her eardrums hurt.
She cannot imagine the sound coming from a tiny animal that barely reaches her shins.
She covers her ears and closes her eyes, wincing as the sound wave almost knocks her over.
As her ears stop ringing, she feels a massive shadow descending upon her.
Pepe opens her eyes to see a formidable creature prowling in the middle of the street, faint patterns with a wondrous gleam roving upon its sandy fur.
Transfixed, she meets the beast's gaze and feels as though her very soul is being drawn into those golden eyes.
Her breath and heartbeat seem to fall under its control, ready to cease at its will.
Unable to move a single muscle, she watches helplessly as the beast slowly approaches, its crimson maw parting...
And swallows her whole.
All goes dark.
Anat, Acting Curator of Varjavandabad Museum. Yes, we are aware, but unfortunately we do not have the resources...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Our experts are being deployed across the city. We do not currently have the manpower to assess your losses...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Of course we value your sponsorship, but...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Anat, Acting Curator of Varjavandabad Museum... no, we are unable to offer any comment at this time.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: ...What? No, the museum is already on lockdown. No collection can leave the building.
attributes.name: Anat
Anat
attributes.content: The museum has nothing to do with the constructs in the city...

attributes.name: Anat
attributes.content: Hello?
attributes.joined: The museum has nothing to do with the constructs in the city...Hello?

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Anat, Acting Curator of Varjavandabad Museum...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* Sorry, we're getting a lot of sand and dust here.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I assure you, on behalf of Varjavandabad Museum that we will offer restoration services at the earliest opportunity...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* ...Appraisal?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: The constructs have built a statue in your garden? And several pillars? May I have a description?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: ...Yes, the ornaments you described fit the traits of first-century art style. It had gone into decline prior to the founding of Menat-Ha'mait, and many of its techniques are considered lost.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I will send someone as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Titi, can you go over?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Do you think it's possible? That the constructs can build, sculpt, and master techniques believed to be long lost?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I don't want to, but...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Looks like you have a bad feeling about it too.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Which is why we need to see it to believe it.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: What is it, Titi?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: You said 'see it to believe it', right?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Carried by the dry winds, sand creeps up like an overflowing river, covering the feet of fleeing passersby.
Grains of sand gather before their eyes and form into shapes, as though poured into invisible molds.
Pillars and walls begin to rise from the streets.
Beast reliefs and patterns imitating Originium circuits, coupled with the worship of sundials and time, representative of the era when Lugalszargus's influence was at its strongest.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Titi, now's not a good time...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: This might be the 'memory' of the constructs. Can it even be counted as a form of restored artifact?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: But we didn't see any constructs nearby—
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: —Ruuuuun!!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Where did they come from, anyway?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: *pant* *pant* Questions later, Titi! You've got to run faster than me, and pull me along!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: We... we're done for if we run at my speed!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Don't worry, you're running fast enough. Hang in there, try not to pass out, and let me observe them a little longer...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Oh, and don't look back. Probably not good for your heart to see them smashing the curator's favorite murals to pieces.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Wh-What?!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: The museum that the curator entrusted to me... the padishah's favorite museum... it's all over...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Have mercy on me, Shahanshah! Watch over me, Exalted Lugalszargus!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Watch out—!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Great Horakhet, I pray to you again! Allow your child to see your face again! I-I want to see the sunrise tomorrow! I want to see it shine once more on the museum!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: The babbling Anat trips and falls.
Titi catches her just before her face hits the ground, but the two of them hear a loud noise.
It sounds like a machine turning on.
*pant* *pant* Narantuya! We finally found you!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: We haven't heard from you since you bought us drinks last night! We were so worried!
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: I haven't had a shut-eye in days, so I slept in longer. What's there to worry about?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Anyway, good timing. Give me a hand.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Why are you still helping other people carry stuff?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Shh, I'm not doing this for anyone else, it's for myself.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: This is obviously an old statue. Better to get something out of it than to just leave it on the streets.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: But Narantuya... Isn't it made by one of the metal constructs?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Huh? What metal constructs?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Lay it out for me slowly. I might have slept too soundly last night and missed some headlines.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I thought you were the sharp one, Narantuya. How could you have missed it? There are weird metal constructs all over the street. Didn't they come at you?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: They're tearing houses apart, making walls and pillars out of sand... and grabbing gems. Maybe you should check?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Everyone lost something last night, from onyx necklaces on their necks to astrolabes that simulate the moons and stars.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Is that what happened to your hairpin?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Wha... where did my hairpin go?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: You got one thing right, I'm sharper than you.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: And I'm starting to feel that something is off.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Anyway, now that I have the intel, time to come up with a plan.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Take off any gems you're wearing and hide them. If those metal constructs are robbers, let them come for me first.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Join the fleeing crowds and get your smoke bombs ready.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: But where do we go?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Everyone else can hide in their homes or at least stay in hotels behind locked doors. Are... we going back to the sewers?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: No problem, I know the way. I'll help us find our sleeping bags.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: No... we're going back to the museum.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The museum? How could that place be safe when they'll hire people like me and Ajazi?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Think about it. Who are the experts on caravan routes, desert terrain, dune movement, burdenbeast habits, and tribal faiths? Bandits, meaning us.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: So, who are the experts on the dead coming back to life, ancient curses, and necromancy? The museum folks.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: ...Makes sense.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: I hear something.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Perfect timing. I want to see what those metal constructs are all about.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: —Alright I get it now. Let's go!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Are we practicing our escape?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: No, this IS the escape!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Let's hope smoke bombs work on these things!
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: She turns around, raises her hand, and prepares to pull the pin on the smoke bomb—
Suddenly, the streets grow quiet.
The sound of marching machines disappears.
All the metal constructs Narantuya can see slow down.
They stop chasing them and gather around Narantuya.
Calm and docile, they watch like tamed burdenbeasts as Narantuya walks past them.
—And back.
What the hey...?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Am I dreaming?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: It's not a dream, Narantuya. I pinched myself just now. It hurt.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Thanks. Then I won't try it myself.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What's going on?
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Say... I saw a shadow of the river god the night before.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Maybe it really did bless me.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: I understand now.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Ajazi, Ajani, go on to the museum without me.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Divine duty. I need to find someone.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The river god must have wanted me to act the hero, and show Aspasia that I'm the boss.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: 'Those who stand by me need no longer be enemies of your warriors.'
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: The jewel constructs are following the pact of the two human sovereigns a thousand years ago. They recognize her blood...
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: You were right, Zubayr. She is the descendant of Kharanduu Khagan.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: Come, young Nightzmora. Walk into the dream—
attributes.name: Woof
